Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description:
Tim Duncan came back from a 1-for-12 start to score 16 of his 22 points in the fourth quarter as the San Antonio
Spurs held off the Washington Wizards 96-91 Tuesday night.

related.description: The San Antonio Spurs put rookie point guard Tony Parker on the injured list Tuesday, a day after he sprained his ankle in the opening minutes of a loss to the New Jersey Nets.
related.linkText: Point missing: Spurs' Parker out 2-3 weeks
related.title: Spurs place point guard on injured list
related.headline: Spurs place point guard on injured list

article.headline: Duncan bails out Spurs; Jordan shoots 5-for-21

images.name: Jordan_Michael 011502 inline
images.caption: Michael Jordan and Doug Collins argue with official Ted Bernhardt during Tuesday's loss.

article.linkText: Jordan struggles, Wiz drop third in a row
article.story:
WASHINGTON (AP) -- Michael Jordan took the plural out of "we stink." "I stunk," Jordan said. Jordan shot just 5-of-21 from the field and 10-of-16 on free throws, scoring 20 points in 40 minutes as the undermanned and tiring Washington Wizards lost their third straight game Tuesday night, 96-91 to the San Antonio Spurs. "I missed six free throws," Jordan said. "Six free throws make the difference in the ball game. I really didn't play the way I wanted to play. ... I had some good shots. I had some good looks, and I stunk it up." It was a night when two great players had three miserable quarters. The difference was the fourth: Tim Duncan found his legs, and Jordan didn't. Duncan started 1-for-12, but he scored 16 of his 22 points in the final 12 minutes as the Spurs held off a couple of rallies to break a two-game losing streak. San Antonio never trailed, and the difference early was Charles Smith, who made his first career start in place of injured Tony Parker and scored a career-high 21 points. Smith's defense was also a key to Jordan's off-night. "I told him the good news is you get to start tonight," coach Gregg Popovich said. "And the bad news is you get to guard Michael. I was real proud of him. He did good work." Said Smith: "I thought about it all day today after coach told me I was starting and I was guarding Michael. But hey, I used to watch him as a kid. I just said: 'Well, I'm going to be in awe for a minute, but once the ball tips up, I have to defend him and do my job.' And that's what I did." After an impressive run that put them in playoff position, the Wizards have lost three straight to three top teams -- Milwaukee, Minnesota and San Antonio -- falling behind early each time. But they are no longer a "We stink" team, as Jordan called them early in the season, in part because injuries to starters Richard Hamilton and Christian Laettner are finally taking their toll. In addition, Tyronn Lue did not dress Tuesday because of a strained groin. All five starters played at least 32 minutes, and only four points came from the bench. "We're running on fumes," forward Popeye Jones said. The Wizards did have a chance to tie in the final seconds. Trailing by three, Jordan drew a double-team and passed to Chris Whitney, who missed a 3-pointer with less than five seconds to play. Duncan was then fouled, and he made a pair of free throws with 1.1 seconds left. Hubert Davis led Washington with a season-high 22 points on 10-for-14 shooting. Whitney added season-highs of 20 points and four steals. Jahidi White finished with a career-high 19 rebounds and 15 points. Steve Smith scored 18 points on 7-for-10 shooting, including 3-of-4 from 3-point range, for the Spurs. David Robinson had 10 points and 10 rebounds. Jordan missed his first three shots and dribbled the ball off his foot for a turnover as the Spurs took an 8-0 lead in the first three minutes. Steve Smith had seven points as San Antonio took an 18-10 lead on his 3-pointer with 4:59 left in the first quarter. Two minutes later, the Spurs opened a 24-10 lead on Charles Smith's steal and dunk. Game notes
The Spurs placed Parker on the injured list with a sprained right ankle and activated Jason Hart, who had been on the injured list since Dec. 21 with a lower back sprain. Parker is expected to miss 2-3 weeks. . . Lue's status is day-to-day. . . Washington coach Doug Collins hopes to have Laettner available for Saturday's game at Chicago. . . The Wizards had their 17th consecutive home sellout. ... Whitney made the 400th 3-pointer of his career.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
